item.title: Rider Roadmap: What to Expect From the Upcoming Updates and Releases
item.description: With Rider 2025.2 already out in the wild and the 2025.3 release cycle underway, we want to take a step back and give you a broader picture of where Rider is headed. This roadmap covers our plans for Rider 2025.3 and what you can expect from the minor updates included in the 2025.2 release line. [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2025/09/25/rider-rider-roadmap-2025-3/

item.title: Why Is Python So Popular in 2025?
item.description: While other programming languages come and go, Python has stood the test of time and firmly established itself as a top choice for developers of all levels, from beginners to seasoned professionals. Whether youâ€™re working on intelligent systems or data-driven workflows, Python has a pivotal role to play in how your software is built, scaled, [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/pycharm/2025/09/why-is-python-so-popular/

item.title: The Kotlin AI Stack: Build AI Agents With Koog, Code Smarter With Junie, and More
item.description: AI is changing how we build software, and Kotlin is ready to meet that change by empowering developers to build AI-powered apps and by enhancing the developer experience through AI-based tools. This post explores both angles: the tools for developing AI-powered apps, both from JetBrains and from the community, and the ways Kotlin is evolving [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2025/09/the-kotlin-ai-stack-build-ai-agents-with-koog-code-smarter-with-junie-and-more/

item.title: The Ktor roadmap and previews
item.description: As in previous years, we have been working on the Ktor roadmap, and we want to say thank everyone for their contributions and feedback to help us prioritize the roadmap! The OpenAPI and WebRTC support is already in preview since the Ktor 3.3.0 release. Check out the Whatâ€™s New section for a full overview of [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2025/09/ktor-roadmap-2025/

item.title: From AI-Generated to Production-Ready Code: WebStorm Refactorings for the Modern Workflow
item.description: Weâ€™ve all been there. You ask your AI tool to generate a React component, and the initial result works perfectly in the beginning. The AI gives you a functional 250-line component that gets the job done quickly and is exactly what you need for rapid prototyping. But even though AI does indeed excel at generating [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/webstorm/2025/09/from-ai-generated-to-production-ready-code-webstorm-refactorings-for-the-modern-workflow/

item.title: Supercharging Unit Test Generation with in-IDE TestSpark
item.description: Test generation is an essential yet time-consuming part of quality assurance. Automating test-generation techniques means accelerating the development process and improving the quality of the final software. However, traditional automated techniques, and their respective tools, are not usually user-friendly, having a command-line interface and not being integrated with the IDE. To boost acceleration and quality [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/research/2025/09/testspark-unit-test-generation/

item.title: Islands Theme: The New Look Coming to JetBrains IDEs
item.description: Starting with version 2025.2.3, JetBrains IDEs will offer a new look: the Islands theme, available in both dark and light modes. This update is a visual refresh, which means that all functionality will remain the same. The new theme can be turned on or off in the Appearance settings. This step brings us closer to [â€¦] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/platform/2025/09/islands-theme-the-new-look-coming-to-jetbrains-ides/
